content: What's the current/recommended way to send an email notification to an admin when content is submitted?
Rules? Or I see a few different "Notify" modules? Or is this functionality in core?
fwiw; on b.org we do a custom module

https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/trigger_actions

backdrop-contrib/trigger_actions
The Trigger Actions module provides the ability to cause actions to run when certain triggers take place on your site. - backdrop-contrib/trigger_actions
@Laryn I was on phone yesterday, that's why I just posted the link to the Trigger Actions module. AFAIK, it replaces the former Trigger / Actions core functionality which was removed from Backdrop.

Has someone a site at hand where visitor registration is enabled? (See admin/config/people/settings: Who can register accounts? Visitors, but administrator approval is required.) I'm trying to reproduce an issue posted in the forum (https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/empty-email-send-administrator-created-new-user-account). On my test site a new user gets notified about the account pending approval, but the admin doesn't get a notification about the new registration. Do these admin notifications work for anyone?
One way to test this is by enabling Reroute Email. (Or setting up Mailhog with Lando) Then you can just check the logs instead of emails

Thanks for the Reroute Email hint, very useful! Interesting test results:

  1. The mail user_register_pending_approval_admin is sent to the E-mail address configured on admin/config/system/site-information. In a way, that makes sense, but the help text of the form element is quite misleading: "The From address in automated e-mails ...". I had entered a no-reply mail address, which makes sense for a From address but not for a real one of the admin.

  2. As stated in the forum issue, the mail notification is indeed sent, but with empty subject and empty body.
